ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learnt how to think and consider musical theater in a way I had never before, viewing it within a theoretical and experiential framework at the same time. Thinking deeply about the relationship between musical theaters constantly mutable nature in relation to stakeholders and the current socio-political climate constructs an understanding past simply the entertainment value of musical theater, past even the passion we all clearly hold for it.

I learned how to look at the big picture of contemporary musical theater and how the art form is changing/staying the same today. I learned how to apply analytical skills to the study of musical theater.
I learned about the trends seen in contemporary musical theater as well as how to analyze the medium of musical theater on a macro scale.
I have a greater appreciation and understanding of the musical, commercial, textual and thematic elements of modern musicals

A comprehensive review of most of the significant musicals written in the last 10 years. Plus, a lot of insight into how to write/think about musical theater, and an awesome network of theater-interested peers to work with in future years at Yale!
how to analyze both content and form of the contemporary american musical, the several factors at play in the creation and success of a musical

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really liked the broad variety of shows covered this semester, as it helped with our overall analysis of musical theater. Professor Egan is also a fantastic teacher, and he deftly helped us navigate the maze that is the current trends in musical theater.

Strengths: class discussion, professor expertise , materials covered

Weaknesses: sometimes repetitive
This class was really, really awesome. I wouldn't change anything!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! Its a wonderful space to think deeply about musical theater surrounded by other like-minded people each with varying passions and investments.
If youre interested in musical theater Id definitely recommend!
Absolutely! Professor Egan is fantastic, and you will learn a lot about contemporary musical theater.
Yes! Especially if you have an inkling of interest in the field
I couldn't recommend this course higher. Dan Egan is a great professor who teaches the class really well. One of my favorite classes I've taken!

Absolutely! Egans seminars are always super engaging and fun, and if you enjoy musical theater at all, this is such a phenomenal class for either TAPS major credit or even as a really great humanities credit.

ABSOLUTELY take this course if you are interested in musical theater! definitely requires an existing interest/knowledge of mt but also exposes you to so many new shows and new lenses through which to examine musicals
